ARABIC: وَإِذْ قَتَلْتُمْ نَفْسًا فَٱدَّٰرَْٰٔتُمْ فِيهَا وَٱللَّهُ مُخْرِجٌ مَّا كُنتُمْ تَكْتُمُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Remember when you killed someone and violently accused each other of it, and Allah brought out what you were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Remember when you killed a man and blamed each other for the deed, God brought to light what you concealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: You should also recall to mind another incident: You slew a man and began to dispute about the murder and accuse one another of it, but Allah had decreed that what you were trying to hide should be disclosed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: When you murdered someone, each one of you tried to accuse others of being guilty. However, God made public what you were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And (remember) when you slew a man and were therefore accusing each other concerning it; and Allah wanted to expose what you were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And (remember) when you killed a man and disagreed among yourselves as to the crime. But Allah brought forth that which you were Taktumun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And when you killed a man, then you disagreed with respect to that, and Allah was to bring forth that which you were going to hide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And when you killed a living soul, and disputed thereon -- and God disclosed what you were hiding --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And (remember) when ye slew a man and disagreed concerning it and Allah brought forth that which ye were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Then, when you [Israelites] killed someone and started to blame one another, God brought to light what you concealed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And recall what time ye slew a person, then quarrelled among yourselves respecting it, and Allah was to bring out that which ye were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And when you killed a soul, and accused one another about it—and Allah was to expose what you were concealing—
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Remember ye slew a man and fell into a dispute among yourselves as to the crime: But Allah was to bring forth what ye did hide.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And (remember) when you killed a man and fell into dispute among yourselves as to the crime. But Allah brought forth that which you were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And when you slew a soul and then fell out with one another concerning it, Allah made known what you concealed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And recall when you killed a person, and disputed in the matter; but God was to expose what you were hiding.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [recall] when you slew a man and disputed over it, but Allah was to bring out that which you were concealing.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [2:72] And when you killed a living soul, and disputed thereon (iddāra’tum: the tā’ [of the root-form itdāra’tum] has been assimilated with the dāl) — and God disclosed what you were hiding (this is a parenthetical statement; the story begins here [with wa-idh qataltum nafsan, ‘and when you killed a soul’… and continues in the following]):
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Then Allah mentioned the murdered person, saying: (And (remember) when ye slew a man) 'Amil (and disagreed concerning it) concerning his murder (and Allah brought forth that which ye were hiding) thus demonstrating what you hid with regard to his murder.
